subject: Management
title: The Pygmalion Effect
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Pygmalion Effect.

hook.text: Teachers told some students were gifted. Those students' IQ scores actually rose. They weren't really gifted.

buildup.text: The Pygmalion effect: high expectations create high performance. Belief becomes reality.

discovery.text: Rosenthal proved it: people perform better when someone they respect believes they can.

twist.text: The reverse is also true. Low expectations produce low results. This is the Golem effect.

climax.text: As a leader, your belief in someone shapes their performance more than their raw talent.

punchline.text: Expect greatness and you'll see more of it.

quiz.question: What is the Pygmalion effect?
options: High expectations from leaders improve actual performance
People always perform at their natural ability level
